lines.content: Duke is a simple command line app to manage and store your tasks.
1. Ensure that you have Java `11` or above installed in your computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for Duke.
4. Write the command `java -jar Duke.jar` to start the application.
You should see the following output:
Hello! I'm Duke, your personal task assistant.
Get started by adding a task, or type help to see what I can do.
If you are starting the app for the first time, you may also see this:
You don't have any saved tasks!
Adds a todo to the list.
Shows the added todo and its description.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds an event to the list.
Shows the added event and its description.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a deadline to the list.
Shows the added deadline and its description.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Shows the list of added tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Finds tasks containing the given keyword(s).
Shows a list of tasks containing the keyword(s).
Here are the tasks in your list:
Nice! I've marked the task as done:
Deletes a task from the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Shows a list of commands and their usage.
Here are a list of commands:
todo - adds a new to-do task
deadline - adds a new task with a due date
Shows a message and exits the app.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* Carries out instructions based on input and commands received
* @param tasksList task list editor containing list of tasks
public void handleCommand(CommandType command, String input, TaskList tasksList, Storage storage) {
* Save tasks in list to a file
public void saveTasks(ArrayList<Task> tasks, Storage storage) {
/** Types of commands currently in use. */
LIST_TASKS, MARK_DONE, ADD_TODO, ADD_DEADLINE, ADD_EVENT, DELETE_TASK, HELP, GREETING, EXIT, DEFAULT, FIND
* Returns the command from the user's input.
* @return command type, represented by an enumeration.
* Saves the list of tasks to a file.
* @throws IOException If an error occurs while saving to the file.
public void saveListToFile(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {
FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(FILE_DIRECTORY + FILE_SEPARATOR + FILE_NAME);
* Gets the list of tasks from a file.
* @param tasks list to save tasks to
* @throws FileNotFoundException If file does not exist
public void getTasksFromFile(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws FileNotFoundException {
File f = new File(FILE_DIRECTORY + FILE_SEPARATOR + FILE_NAME); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner s = new Scanner(f); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
return OPEN_BRACKET + typeIcon + CLOSE_BRACKET + super.toString() + " (by: " + date + ")";
return OPEN_BRACKET + typeIcon + CLOSE_BRACKET + super.toString() + " (at: " + date + ")";
* Gets the status icon for a task.
* Gets the date of a task (deadline or event).
* Gets the status of a task.
* @return true if task is done, false otherwise.
* Sets a task's status to the given status.
* Gets the description of a task
* Gets letters representing the type of task
* @return "T" if task type is todo, "D" if task type is deadline, or "E" if task type is event
return OPEN_BRACKET + getStatusIcon() + CLOSE_BRACKET + SPACE + description;
* @param index task number of task to be deleted
* @param index task number of task to be marked as done
* Gets input when the user inputs a newline.
* Prints a message when the program starts.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Hello! I'm Duke, your personal task assistant." + NEWLINE +
"Get started by adding a task, or type help to see what I can do." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when the task number given is out of bounds.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Oops, I can't find that task in the list!" + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when the format of the task number is incorrect
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Oops, that is not a valid task number!" + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when a task is already completed.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "This task has been completed!" + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message if the task description is not given.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Please tell me the name of the task." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message if the date for a deadline is not given.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Please tell me what the task is and when it is due." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message if the date for an event is not given.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Please tell me what the event is and when it is happening." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when the user types "hello".
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Hello! What can I do for you?" + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when the user exits the program.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!" + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when the user input matches none of the commands.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "I'm not sure what you want to do.");
System.out.println("Type help for a list of commands." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when command parsed does not match any of the commands. (This should not occur.)
* Prints a message when the task list is empty.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "There are no tasks in the list!" + NEWLINE);

public void printAddedTask(ArrayList<Task> tasks, Task task) {
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list." + NEWLINE);
* Prints a message when a task is deleted
* @param task task deleted from the list
public void printDeletedTask(ArrayList<Task> tasks, Task task) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list." + NEWLINE);
* Prints the list of tasks, as well as their type and status.
System.out.println(NEWLINE + "Here are the tasks in your list:");

printCommandHelpMessage("delete", "deletes a task from the list",
